snippet: Rob Morris, a Lutheran pastor who lost a congregation member in the Sandy Hook massacre, apologized after he took part in an interfaith service, violating a denominational rule.
abstract: Rev Rob Morris, Lutheran pastor who participated in an interfaith prayer service in Newtown, Conn, in the days after the Sandy Hook massacre, apologizes after being criticized by the leader of his conservative branch for violating its prohibition against joint worship with other religions.
lead_paragraph: Rob Morris, a Lutheran pastor who lost a congregation member in the Sandy Hook massacre, apologized after he took part in an interfaith service, violating a denominational rule.

headline.seo: Lutheran Minister Explains Role in Sandy Hook Interfaith Service
headline.main: Pastor Apologizes to His Denomination for Role in Sandy Hook Interfaith Service
headline.print_headline: Pastor Is Sorry For His Role In a Service
